column5: Has anyone ever heard of these rigs?  I heard they are great for perch.
Yup, They seem to appear @  random in Canadian Tire stores. (at least that's where I've seen them most). Sometimes I'd spot them @ WAL-MART too...
Do yourself a favor and consider purchasing some of these!  http://www.cabelas.com/cabelas/en/template...&hasJS=true  I kill the Crappie with them and I know they'll catch Perch too!
but don't forget to cut 2 hooks off

.. or you can just bait 4 and leave the other 2 bare!... 4 baited hook points or 6 hook points to a lure eh!!!   ... or you can purchase the much stronger but more expensive 4 hook Hayabusa Sabiki rig!

the way I read it  4 hooks, I don't see any other way of looking at it  Hook – A hook includes a single-pointed or multiple-pointed hook on a common shaft but does not include a snagger or spring gaff. The number of hooks includes any single-pointed or multiple-pointed hooks that are part of a lure. Hooks and Lines – An angler may use only one line, unless otherwise stated in the regulations. Two lines may be used when angling from a boat in parts of the Great Lakes (see Exceptions to the General Regulations) and for ice fishing in many areas (see Ice Fishing, page 11). A fishing line must not have more than four hooks attached.
I use the double hook pickerel rig for perch.
They work fantastic on Erie perch, best way to go
